.NET SDK Exceptions Overview

Table of Contents

Introduction to .NET SDK Exception handling

The .NET SDK handles errors through exceptions rather than error return codes.


Exception Classes

  • AccessDeniedException : IonicSecurity::SDK::AccessDeniedException
  • SdkException : IonicSecurity::SDK::SdkException
  • ServerException : IonicSecurity::SDK::ServerException


Example Usage

try {
// ChunkCrypto is similar to FileCrypto, but for use with Strings
ChunkCipherAuto cipher = new ChunkCipherAuto(agent);
// Encrypt and decrypt
cipher.Encrypt(inputString, ref encryptedString);
cipher.Decrypt(encryptedString, ref outputString);
}
catch (SdkException e)
{
// Log the error for debugging purposes
Console.Error.WriteLine("Error Logged: {0}", e.Message);
// Display a mesage to the user
switch (e.ErrorCodeEnum)
{
case ErrorCode.AGENT_KEY_DENIED:
Console.WriteLine("Access denied!");
break;
case ErrorCode.AGENT_REQUESTFAILED:
Console.WriteLine("Network error, check your internet connection!");
break;
default:
Console.WriteLine("Error! " + e.Message);
break;
}
}
catch (Exception e)
{
Console.WriteLine("Uknown error occured!");
}
IonicSecurity::SDK::ErrorCode
ErrorCode
Enumeration that represents error codes from the C++ SDK.
Definition: ErrorCode.h:32
